question_sentence: Which African country was the unexpected recipient of the toughest of the US tariffs unveiled this week?
evidence: Goods from the mountainous kingdom, home to a little over two million people, were hit with a 50% tariff – higher than those imposed on China, India and the EU. Lesotho's most profitable exports are diamonds and clothing, with the US its largest trading partner after South Africa.

question_sentence: An Isar Aerospace Spectrum rocket launched from where before crashing into the sea?
evidence: German company Isar Aerospace launched its Spectrum orbital rocket from a Norwegian spaceport, but the rocket crashed and exploded 30 seconds after lift-off. The company aims to build a commercial space industry and said the crash allowed it to "gather a substantial amount of flight data and experience to apply on future missions".

question_sentence: France's far-right presidential hopeful Marine Le Pen has been barred from running for political office for how many years?
evidence: Le Pen, whose National Rally party is currently leading in voter intention polls, had already announced her plans to run in France's 2027 presidential election when a Paris court handed down the sentence. She intends to appeal against the verdict, which found Le Pen and party colleagues guilty of misusing European Parliament funds.

question_sentence: How many hours did US Senator Cory Booker speak in making the longest speech in Senate history?
evidence: The senator, who was protesting President Donald Trump's hardline policies, spoke for 25 hours and 5 minutes. The previous record of 24 hours and 18 minutes was set by Strom Thurmond during his filibuster against the Civil Rights Act of 1957. During Booker's speech, he did not eat, sit or go to the bathroom.

question_sentence: The story of which band will be released as a "bingeable" multi-movie experience in April 2028?
evidence: Paul Mescal, Joseph Quinn, Barry Keoghan and Harris Dickinson have been unveiled as the stars of the four-movie Beatles biopic, with each instalment telling the life of a different band member. Not everyone is convinced that cinemas need to join the bingeing culture. Are we "supposed to sit through them all back-to-back like people do for 'The Lord of the Rings'", asked Fran Hoepfner on Vulture.

question_sentence: Which vaccine has been found to help reduce the chances of developing Alzheimer's and other forms of dementia?
evidence: A study published in Nature found that those vaccinated with an older live-virus vaccine, like Zostavax, were 20% less likely to develop dementia within seven years compared to those unvaccinated. The findings were based on the health records of 280,000 people in Wales.

question_sentence: How many men have been called up in the Russian military's latest draft?
evidence: Military service in Russia is mandatory for men aged 18-30, with call-ups issued twice a year – but this round of conscription is the largest since 2011. The size of the draft has stoked speculation that Moscow is looking to bolster its depleted forces in Ukraine, but the country's defence ministry maintains that no conscripts will be sent into combat.

question_sentence: A country home associated with which author is to be demolished despite a battle to save it?
evidence: UK planning authorities have approved the demolition of Ashe Park House near Basingstoke. The novelist was born a mile from the Hampshire country house and attended balls there in the 1790s, mentioning the estate several times in her letters.

question_sentence: A Looney Tunes movie starring which character is to be released a year after being shelved by Warner Bros?
evidence: Live-action/animation hybrid "Coyote vs. Acme" sees Wile E. Coyote's attempt to sue the fictional manufacturer over his failed efforts to ensnare the Roadrunner. The movie – which cost $72 million to make – was shelved by Warner Bros last year as a tax write-off, but has now been bought by distributor Ketchup Entertainment. Listen to this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped to find out how movies fall victim to "Hollywood accounting".

question_sentence: A woman with the world's longest tongue has shown off her skills by using it to play what game?
evidence: Chanel Tapper, 34, set a record for having the longest tongue, measuring 3.8 inches. In a video for Guinness World Records, she also showcases her tongue's unique talents by flipping a plastic cup.

question_sentence: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen was banned from running for political office for the next five years after being found guilty of which offense?
evidence: Le Pen was found guilty of embezzlement for using European Parliament money to pay staff members who were in fact working for her political party, the National Rally, in France.

question_sentence: At 64 and 60, Antoinette and Brucie-Baby could be the world’s oldest geckos. What is the secret to their longevity?
choices: Their island is free of predators
They eat a specific type of rare insect
They have a very active sex life
evidence: The island where they live is predator-free, without any of the introduced species that have decimated native animals across mainland New Zealand.

question_sentence: Oscar-winning director Sam Mendes is making a new series of biopics about The Beatles. Which actor has been cast to play Ringo Starr?
evidence: Barry Keoghan (“Saltburn”) will play Ringo Starr in “The Beatles - A Four-Film Cinematic Event.”

question_sentence: Why did Democratic attorneys general and governors in 23 states and Washington, DC, file a lawsuit against the Department of Health and Human Services and HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. this week?
choices: To reverse the cancellation of research grants to universities
To block RFK Jr.’s ban on chicken nuggets in public schools
To remove anti-vaccine posts from the HHS website.
evidence: The states are seeking to halt the rollback of $12 billion in public health funding that they say will lead to key services being discontinued and thousands of health care workers losing their jobs.

question_sentence: Although President Trump placed a 10% tariff on imports from Heard Island and the McDonald Islands, the US will never receive any money. Why?
choices: The islands refuse to export products to the US
The islands are not inhabited by people
evidence: No people live on the islands — so there are no exports. They are, however, home to penguins, seals and seabirds.

question_sentence: Nintendo this week revealed details about which new product?
choices: An electric “Mario Kart” go-kart for kids
evidence: Nintendo will release the Nintendo Switch 2 in June — and it’s going to cost $150 more than its predecessor.

question_sentence: More than 240 people fell ill recently due to a norovirus outbreak on which luxury cruise ship?
evidence: The outbreak aboard the Queen Mary 2 comes on the heels of the worst year for cruise ship-based gastrointestinal outbreaks in over a decade.

question_sentence: Paleontologists unearthed a fossil of which type of newly identified species in Australia that may be up to 16 million years old.
evidence: Paleontologists found the fossilized freshwater fish, named Ferruaspis brocksi, at the McGraths Flat site in central New South Wales.

question_sentence: What is the world’s top infectious killer?
evidence: Even though it is treatable and preventable, tuberculosis remains the world’s top infectious killer. The bacterial infection caused 1.25 million deaths worldwide in 2023.

question_sentence: Actor Val Kilmer died this week at the age of 65. Which superhero did he once play?
evidence: In 1995’s “Batman Forever,” Kilmer played the Caped Crusader.
